chapter.title: Working with Reports
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to view reports and take appropriate actions for all modules using Opics Portal. It also helps you to perform inquiries, view pending transactions, and execute reports across all modules.

section.title: About Reports
section.para: Opics Portal facilitates you to browse through all the acknowledgements and notifications sent by the bank, or through consolidated lists of pending transactions or existing records.

In the portal Home page, click Reportsand select from the following group of functions. Some of these functions are similar to the Pending, Inquiry, and Maintenance functions as described in the chapter Portal Functions, but they show transactions across all products.

listitem.para: Review Reporting: To review all transactional messages sent by the bank, whether acknowledgements to transaction events initiated by the client, new events reported by the bank's back-office on an existing record, or new notifications. The details of each transaction event can also be retrieved from the list.
Pending Transactions: As described in chapter PortalFunctions, but shows transactions for all products.
Action Required : To perform this function, appropriate user permissions are required.
Inquiry: As described in chapter PortalFunctions, but shows transactions for all products.
Report Execution: To execute a report designed by an authorized administrator.

section.para: The subsequent sections provide detailed explanation about using these functions and working with reports.

section.title: Review Reporting
section.para: You can view a list of all transactional messages sent by the bank, for all products in Opics Portal. In the portal Home page, click Reports and select Review Reporting.
Specify the following and click Search to view transaction details:

listitem.para: Specify the System ID and Bank Ref number.
Indicate the period for the report from the From and To fields.
Select the Product for which the report is retrieved and specify the Output Format for the report.
Click Search to display reports.

section.title: Output
section.para: The result displays the following details for the report:

entry.para: Specifies a unique reference number generated by for the transaction.
Identifies the bank's internal reference number assigned by the bank's back office to the transaction.

listitem.para: New (for an initiation of a new transaction)
Amend (for an amendment an existing transaction)
Message (for any of the free format / update message available with all the products)
Reporting (if the transaction event is not initiated by the client and is, therefore, an update message initiated and sent by the bank on a given transaction record)

entry.para: Identifies the name of the beneficiary in the transaction.
Indicates a three-digit currency code of the transaction record.
Indicates the transaction amount, that is, the amount involved in the current event.

listitem.para: The total amount of the transaction upon its creation (i.e. when the transaction type is New)
Only the increase or decrease of amount for a modified transaction
A blank value in all other cases, since no amount is associated with other types of event

entry.para: Is the date when the customer initially released the transaction event to the bank.

section.para: Click the action icon of a transaction event to display more information about the transaction. This opens a popup window with the following details:

listitem.para: The top of the page contains the summary information of the event and is common across the various products. It is composed of a first section summarizing the event details (such as its dates, its references and amount).

A second optional section shows additional details, such as the application date and the issuing bankâ€™s name, provided by the input user when preparing the transaction event. It is here that the free format text or an optional file attachment is shown if the transaction event was a free format / update message.

And finally a third section shows the details of the actual reporting message as created by the bank and the updated product status for the transaction after this event, plus any comments or the bank's attachments. It displays information about the contract, such as the type of contract, expiration details, currency, amount, etc.

section.para: The Reporting Status in the popup shows whether the event has been successfully acknowledged by the bank and accordingly what is its updated state.
The possible values of the product status have already been explained in the chapters on the Inquiry functions for the various products. As a reminder, they are:

listitem.para: Rejected indicates that the related event has not been approved by the bank
New indicates the state of any product after its successful initiation
Amended is only applicable if a transaction is successful amendment
Updated is the generic state generally given by the bank as a follow-up to a free format message transaction
Purged is set by the bank to notify its technical termination of a given record
Other statuses can be freely used by the bank with eventually its own interpretations (Accepted, Settled, Cancelled and Extended)

section.para: The rest of the page beyond the horizontal separator shows the most recently updated detailed information on the transaction record as validated by the bank through its reporting. It is specific to each product.
You can also print out the whole content of the popup window or export it to a PDF file for your reference.

note.para: : Refer to corresponding chapters on the individual product modules for further details on the names used to describe each field.

section.title: Pending Transactions
section.para: The portal also displays the status of pending transactions as incomplete, where you can select a transaction and thereby submit it to the bank for its completion.
In the Reports menu, click Pending Transactions to view the status of transactions or to submit an incomplete transaction.
For more information about pending transactions, refer to chapter Portal Functions of this document.

section.title: Actions Required
section.para: You can perform required actions on the transactions if appropriate administrative privileges are configured for your account.
In the Reports menu, click Actions Required to view the list of transaction records for customer action.

note.para: : Contact the system administrator of your organization for these permissions.

section.title: Making an Inquiry
section.para: Opics Portal helps you to perform inquiries for all types of transactions.
In the Reports menu, click Inquiry, specify the required fields, and click Search to view details of a transaction for a particular module in the portal.
For general information about inquiries, refer to chapter Portal Functions or for information performing inquiries on individual modules, refer to the corresponding section of this document.

section.title: Reports Execution
section.para: You can execute reports in Opics portal. In the Reports menu, click Report Execution, specify the Report Name, and click Search to view the report.

You can click the report name to display the selected report. The report may provide a criteria zone, so that you can enter search patterns. You can also select the output format: Screen, CSV export, SpreadSheet (Excel) export or PDF export.
Click Search to execute the report.

note.para: : For executing reports, appropriate permissions and authorization is required for your account.
